snippet: Officials may seek to break down country-by-country partitions that keep pay TV from being a single market in the European Union.
abstract: European Commission opens investigation into ways that major United States film and television studios license their content to European pay-TV providers--practices that the commission says might violate European antitrust rules.
lead_paragraph: Officials may seek to break down country-by-country partitions that keep pay TV from being a single market in the European Union.

headline.main: Europe Opens Inquiry Into Licensing of U.S. Films and TV
headline.print_headline: Europe Opens Inquiry Into Licensing of U.S. Films and TV
